file_content.text: I'm proud to have served by your side.
Purge the enemy in the name of Alderaan. I trust you.
You were viewing restricted information.
I can't track the Killiks without satellite data!
Your confession has been recorded.
This is madness. Sith, tell him!
This is madness. Tell him, bounty hunter!
This is madness. Tell him!
I'm not after your military secrets, but I can't fight blind.
You're a guest of the Empire. But there are limits to Imperial hospitality.
This is a warning. [Threaten]
Do not step out of line again.
I... grant that I have trespassed. I apologize.
You can supervise me as I check my data--then I'll show you what I found.
You did nothing wrong.
We'll get you what you need.
She needs access to Imperial data. We need her to defeat the Killiks. Am I understood?
Yes, sir. I'll give her temporary clearance.
Thank you. Come on--let's see what we've got.
The Black Hive is hurting from what you've done, and I think I've found one of their weaknesses.
Months ago, King Ulgo became aware of the extent of the Killik threat. Instead of alerting my order, he tried to hide the problem by hiring mercenaries.
When they attacked the Killiks, the mercenaries failed. Something of a trend in Ulgo's plans.
I take it that didn't work.
Who exactly did King Ulgo hire?
What kind of mercenaries?
Ulgo went with offworlders instead of Alderaan's own ancient protectors. You must be crushed.
Guess no one likes you.
I assume he didn't think we'd be loyal. We would've been.
The mercenary group was called Blood Company. Run by an alien warlord who was part of the "Manaan Atrocities," according to your files.
Blood Company was absorbed by the hive mind; they all became Joiners, and their knowledge and savagery spread to the Killiks.
If Blood Company is the brain of the hive, then let's cut off the head.
Then we eliminate the Joiners.
What makes a handful of hired killers valuable to the whole Black Nest?
How dangerous is this?
With the minds of the mercenaries come tactics, proficiency with new weapons... a desire to kill.
I'm getting tired of crushing insects. Mercenaries could make things interesting.
Maybe they'll be a challenge.
I don't understand how you can talk like that.
Using the order's lore and Imperial technology, I've made a bait that should lure in the Joiners if used at the right locations.
I'll entrust it to you--I'd be torn apart myself, but... someone has to save this world.
Unlike the Republic, the Empire has the strength to protect its realms.
We stand by our allies.
Aiding you and your people is why I'm on Alderaan.
It will be my privilege.
Thank you, Sith.
I'll move in, plant the bait and disable the mercenaries. Over before you know it.
It'll be a surgical strike.
Saving a planet ought to earn a bonus.
Maybe I should raise my rates.
I'm not your employer, hunter. Speak to House Thul for credits.
House Thul was wise to recruit you. You should be proud of your role in Alderaan's protection.
You've done well.
The credit goes to the order, and there's still much more to do.
This world is nothing more than a resource to be drained. You're fortunate we need you at all.
The Empire doesn't do charity.
At least you're honest about it.
If you can destroy the Joiners, the nest will start to unravel. There's a base farther out--we should move there next.
Good hunting.
We bring fire to the darkness below. The Killiks must be stopped.
In the swarm, the flame will guide me. In hardship, I will endure.
Chanya Medaal? Serjay Thul sent us.
Chanya Medaal? Serjay Thul sent me.
What...? Of course... allies of the Sith who would be king.
On behalf of the Knights of the Order of Extermination and the Blood of Aldera, I offer my services in the war against the Killiks. Ventadya droth, qe no fora.
When it comes to slaying Killiks, I'm told you know more than anyone.
I hear you're an expert....
Why do I sense you're not happy partnering with House Thul?
You sound a little reluctant.
I'd partner with the Emperor himself if it meant saving Alderaan--and it's not my place to judge.
I don't care about your order or its rituals. Tell me who we're killing and how.
Skip past the ceremony.
Is that all this is to you? Mayhem without reason?
For twenty thousand years, my order has fought the nests. We know their hibernation cycles, the secrets of their Joiners.
We should be advising the armies of a united planet. Instead, we're a handful against the Black Hive.
Your order has never possessed the power of the Sith. Now you are unstoppable.
We will be victorious.
We don't need armies. I can show you how to turn secrets into power enough to end the threat.
Knowledge gives us strength.
I hope you're right.
Sometimes, a few dedicated soldiers is all it takes to win a war. But we need to play this smart.
You won't need an army.
That's why you're in charge of the big picture. I'll tell you what you need to know.
People only call in troubleshooters when it's already too late.
You get used to it.
That's a cynical way to look at the world.
I promise to keep you safe. And if there's anything else I can do to take your mind off the situation....
[Flirt] Don't be worried.
I can protect myself, and my oaths to the order leave no room for other pursuits.
It's my privilege to aid you and take part in your traditions. Where do we begin?
I'm honored to help the order.
Maybe you'd rather fight the Killiks without me.
I can leave, if you'd prefer.
That isn't what I meant, I'm--please, forgive me.
The last time the Black Hive emerged, it left whole cities in ruins. Its Killiks are monstrous, and their bloodlust grows with every Joiner they absorb.
I've been strategizing with the Imperial strike teams. They're making progress, but not enough. You should meet with them, lead our efforts.
I'll see to the strike teams. Keep studying the nest, and let me know what you find.
I'll take charge.
You're the one trained for this. You should be in the field.
So why aren't you with them?
I'm doing all I can, here and knee-deep in Killik membrosia pools. I can't do nearly enough.
You'll learn quickly, if you haven't already: we're fighting a war of fools. Rely on no one.
They're all incompetent.
I would lay down my life to keep one Alderaanian "fool" from becoming a Killik Joiner.
Come, and I'll anoint you with the chanmasu herbs. Whether you believe in ritual or not, the scent will discourage your foe.
...and be guided by the Codex Chitinous and the First Huntsman.
See to the others, and I'll continue to search for weaknesses.
The swarm will always be with us. The swarm must be exterminated.
